creator: tensberg@gmx.net
text:
I've noticed that apparently the order in which mappers are added to the list of
a <chainedmapper> depends on whether the mappers are defined as <mapper
type="..."> or <...mapper>. Mappers defined in the first way are executed after
the other mappers even if they appear earlier in the build file. I'll attach a
build script which demonstrates the behaviour.

Created attachment 18696
ant script which demonstrates the described behaviour
creator: tensberg@gmx.net
peterreilly@apache.org
text:
I can confirm this.
The bug is due to the mixture of add and addConfigured methods on
Mapper and MapperContainer. The add methods are called when
the nested element is encountered and converted to a object but before
"configuration" (setting the attributes and adding the nested elements)
, the addConfigured methods are called after all the nested elements
have been read in and configured. I am preparing a fix.

Peter

creator: peterreilly@apache.org
text:
Fixed by adding an addConfigured method to ContainerMapper,
and by modifing IntrospectionHelper to make addConfigured
higher priority than add.
